00032 /*
00033  * lustre/lod/lod_pool.c
00034  *
00035  * OST pool methods
00036  *
00037  * This file provides code related to the Logical Object Device (LOD)
00038  * handling of OST Pools on the MDT.  Pools are named lists of targets
00039  * that allow userspace to group targets that share a particlar property
00040  * together so that users or kernel helpers can make decisions about file
00041  * allocation based on these properties.  For example, pools could be
00042  * defined based on fault domains (e.g. separate racks of server nodes) so
00043  * that RAID-1 mirroring could select targets from independent fault
00044  * domains, or pools could define target performance characteristics so
00045  * that applicatins could select IOP-optimized storage or stream-optimized
00046  * storage for a particular output file.
00047  *
00048  * This file handles creation, lookup, and removal of pools themselves, as
00049  * well as adding and removing targets to pools.  It also handles lprocfs
00050  * display of configured pool.  The pools are accessed by name in the pool
00051  * hash, and are refcounted to ensure proper pool structure lifetimes.
00052  *
00053  * Author: Jacques-Charles LAFOUCRIERE <jc.lafoucriere@cea.fr>
00054  * Author: Alex Lyashkov <Alexey.Lyashkov@Sun.COM>
00055  * Author: Nathaniel Rutman <Nathan.Rutman@Sun.COM>
00056  */
00057 
00058 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LOV
00059 
00060 #include <libcfs/libcfs.h>
00061 #include <obd.h>
00062 #include "lod_internal.h"
00063 
00064 #define pool_tgt(_p, _i) OST_TGT(lu2lod_dev((_p)->pool_lobd->obd_lu_dev), \
00065                                  (_p)->pool_obds.op_array[_i])
00066 
00077 static void pool_getref(struct pool_desc *pool)
00078 {
00079         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "pool %p\n", pool);
00080         atomic_inc(&pool->pool_refcount);
00081 }
00082 
00095 void lod_pool_putref(struct pool_desc *pool)
00096 {
00097         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "pool %p\n", pool);
00098         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&pool->pool_refcount)) {
00099                 LASSERT(hlist_unhashed(&pool->pool_hash));
00100                 LASSERT(list_empty(&pool->pool_list));
00101                 LASSERT(pool->pool_proc_entry == NULL);
00102                 lod_ost_pool_free(&(pool->pool_rr.lqr_pool));
00103                 lod_ost_pool_free(&(pool->pool_obds));
00104                 OBD_FREE_PTR(pool);
00105                 EXIT;
00106         }
00107 }
00108 
00119 static void pool_putref_locked(struct pool_desc *pool)
00120 {
00121         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "pool %p\n", pool);
00122         LASSERT(atomic_read(&pool->pool_refcount) > 1);
00123 
00124         atomic_dec(&pool->pool_refcount);
00125 }
00126 
00127 /*
00128  * Group of functions needed for cfs_hash implementation.  This
00129  * includes pool lookup, refcounting, and cleanup.
00130  */
00131 
00143 static __u32 pool_hashfn(struct cfs_hash *hash_body, const void *key,
00144                          unsigned mask)
00145 {
00146         return cfs_hash_djb2_hash(key, strnlen(key, LOV_MAXPOOLNAME), mask);
00147 }
00148 
00158 static void *pool_key(struct hlist_node *hnode)
00159 {
00160         struct pool_desc *pool;
00161 
00162         pool = hlist_entry(hnode, struct pool_desc, pool_hash);
00163         return pool->pool_name;
00164 }
00165 
00178 static int pool_hashkey_keycmp(const void *key, struct hlist_node *compared)
00179 {
00180         return !strncmp(key, pool_key(compared), LOV_MAXPOOLNAME);
00181 }
00182 
00194 static void *pool_hashobject(struct hlist_node *hnode)
00195 {
00196         return hlist_entry(hnode, struct pool_desc, pool_hash);
00197 }
00198 
00199 static void pool_hashrefcount_get(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct hlist_node *hnode)
00200 {
00201         struct pool_desc *pool;
00202 
00203         pool = hlist_entry(hnode, struct pool_desc, pool_hash);
00204         pool_getref(pool);
00205 }
00206 
00207 static void pool_hashrefcount_put_locked(struct cfs_hash *hs,
00208                                          struct hlist_node *hnode)
00209 {
00210         struct pool_desc *pool;
00211 
00212         pool = hlist_entry(hnode, struct pool_desc, pool_hash);
00213         pool_putref_locked(pool);
00214 }
00215 
00216 struct cfs_hash_ops pool_hash_operations = {
00217         .hs_hash        = pool_hashfn,
00218         .hs_key         = pool_key,
00219         .hs_keycmp      = pool_hashkey_keycmp,
00220         .hs_object      = pool_hashobject,
00221         .hs_get         = pool_hashrefcount_get,
00222         .hs_put_locked  = pool_hashrefcount_put_locked,
00223 };
00224 
00225 /*
00226  * Methods for /proc seq_file iteration of the defined pools.
00227  */
00228 
00229 #define POOL_IT_MAGIC 0xB001CEA0
00230 struct lod_pool_iterator {
00231         unsigned int      lpi_magic;    /* POOL_IT_MAGIC */
00232         unsigned int      lpi_idx;      /* from 0 to pool_tgt_size - 1 */
00233         struct pool_desc *lpi_pool;
00234 };
00235 
00252 static void *pool_proc_next(struct seq_file *seq, void *v, loff_t *pos)
00253 {
00254         struct lod_pool_iterator *iter = seq->private;
00255         int prev_idx;
00256 
00257         LASSERTF(iter->lpi_magic == POOL_IT_MAGIC, "%08X\n", iter->lpi_magic);
00258 
00259         /* test if end of file */
00260         if (*pos >= pool_tgt_count(iter->lpi_pool))
00261                 return NULL;
00262 
00263         /* iterate to find a non empty entry */
00264         prev_idx = iter->lpi_idx;
00265         down_read(&pool_tgt_rw_sem(iter->lpi_pool));
00266         iter->lpi_idx++;
00267         if (iter->lpi_idx == pool_tgt_count(iter->lpi_pool)) {
00268                 iter->lpi_idx = prev_idx; /* we stay on the last entry */
00269                 up_read(&pool_tgt_rw_sem(iter->lpi_pool));
00270                 return NULL;
00271         }
00272         up_read(&pool_tgt_rw_sem(iter->lpi_pool));
00273         (*pos)++;
00274         /* return != NULL to continue */
00275         return iter;
00276 }
00277 
00293 static void *pool_proc_start(struct seq_file *seq, loff_t *pos)
00294 {
00295         struct pool_desc *pool = seq->private;
00296         struct lod_pool_iterator *iter;
00297 
00298         pool_getref(pool);
00299         if ((pool_tgt_count(pool) == 0) ||
00300             (*pos >= pool_tgt_count(pool))) {
00301                 /* iter is not created, so stop() has no way to
00302                  * find pool to dec ref */
00303                 lod_pool_putref(pool);
00304                 return NULL;
00305         }
00306 
00307         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(iter);
00308         if (iter == NULL)
00309                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
00310         iter->lpi_magic = POOL_IT_MAGIC;
00311         iter->lpi_pool = pool;
00312         iter->lpi_idx = 0;
00313 
00314         seq->private = iter;
00315         if (*pos > 0) {
00316                 loff_t i;
00317                 void *ptr;
00318 
00319                 i = 0;
00320                 do {
00321                         ptr = pool_proc_next(seq, &iter, &i);
00322                 } while ((i < *pos) && (ptr != NULL));
00323 
00324                 return ptr;
00325         }
00326 
00327         return iter;
00328 }
00329 
00344 static void pool_proc_stop(struct seq_file *seq, void *v)
00345 {
00346         struct lod_pool_iterator *iter = seq->private;
00347 
00348         if (iter != NULL && iter->lpi_magic == POOL_IT_MAGIC) {
00349                 seq->private = iter->lpi_pool;
00350                 lod_pool_putref(iter->lpi_pool);
00351                 OBD_FREE_PTR(iter);
00352         }
00353 }
00354 
00363 static int pool_proc_show(struct seq_file *seq, void *v)
00364 {
00365         struct lod_pool_iterator *iter = v;
00366         struct lod_tgt_desc  *tgt;
00367 
00368         LASSERTF(iter->lpi_magic == POOL_IT_MAGIC, "%08X\n", iter->lpi_magic);
00369         LASSERT(iter->lpi_pool != NULL);
00370         LASSERT(iter->lpi_idx <= pool_tgt_count(iter->lpi_pool));
00371 
00372         down_read(&pool_tgt_rw_sem(iter->lpi_pool));
00373         tgt = pool_tgt(iter->lpi_pool, iter->lpi_idx);
00374         up_read(&pool_tgt_rw_sem(iter->lpi_pool));
00375         if (tgt != NULL)
00376                 seq_printf(seq, "%s\n", obd_uuid2str(&(tgt->ltd_uuid)));
00377 
00378         return 0;
00379 }
00380 
00381 static const struct seq_operations pool_proc_ops = {
00382         .start  = pool_proc_start,
00383         .next   = pool_proc_next,
00384         .stop   = pool_proc_stop,
00385         .show   = pool_proc_show,
00386 };
00387 
00399 static int pool_proc_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
00400 {
00401         int rc;
00402 
00403         rc = seq_open(file, &pool_proc_ops);
00404         if (!rc) {
00405                 struct seq_file *seq = file->private_data;
00406                 seq->private = PDE_DATA(inode);
00407         }
00408         return rc;
00409 }
00410 
00411 static struct file_operations pool_proc_operations = {
00412         .open           = pool_proc_open,
00413         .read           = seq_read,
00414         .llseek         = seq_lseek,
00415         .release        = seq_release,
00416 };
00417 
00431 void lod_dump_pool(int level, struct pool_desc *pool)
00432 {
00433         unsigned int i;
00434 
00435         pool_getref(pool);
00436 
00437         CDEBUG(level, "pool "LOV_POOLNAMEF" has %d members\n",
00438                pool->pool_name, pool->pool_obds.op_count);
00439         down_read(&pool_tgt_rw_sem(pool));
00440 
00441         for (i = 0; i < pool_tgt_count(pool) ; i++) {
00442                 if (!pool_tgt(pool, i) || !(pool_tgt(pool, i))->ltd_exp)
00443                         continue;
00444                 CDEBUG(level, "pool "LOV_POOLNAMEF"[%d] = %s\n",
00445                        pool->pool_name, i,
00446                        obd_uuid2str(&((pool_tgt(pool, i))->ltd_uuid)));
00447         }
00448 
00449         up_read(&pool_tgt_rw_sem(pool));
00450         lod_pool_putref(pool);
00451 }
00452 
00467 #define POOL_INIT_COUNT 2
00468 int lod_ost_pool_init(struct ost_pool *op, unsigned int count)
00469 {
00470         ENTRY;
00471 
00472         if (count == 0)
00473                 count = POOL_INIT_COUNT;
00474         op->op_array = NULL;
00475         op->op_count = 0;
00476         init_rwsem(&op->op_rw_sem);
00477         op->op_size = count;
00478         OBD_ALLOC(op->op_array, op->op_size * sizeof(op->op_array[0]));
00479         if (op->op_array == NULL) {
00480                 op->op_size = 0;
00481                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00482         }
00483         EXIT;
00484         return 0;
00485 }
00486 
00500 int lod_ost_pool_extend(struct ost_pool *op, unsigned int min_count)
00501 {
00502         __u32 *new;
00503         int new_size;
00504 
00505         LASSERT(min_count != 0);
00506 
00507         if (op->op_count < op->op_size)
00508                 return 0;
00509 
00510         new_size = max(min_count, 2 * op->op_size);
00511         OBD_ALLOC(new, new_size * sizeof(op->op_array[0]));
00512         if (new == NULL)
00513                 return -ENOMEM;
00514 
00515         /* copy old array to new one */
00516         memcpy(new, op->op_array, op->op_size * sizeof(op->op_array[0]));
00517         OBD_FREE(op->op_array, op->op_size * sizeof(op->op_array[0]));
00518         op->op_array = new;
00519         op->op_size = new_size;
00520 
00521         return 0;
00522 }
00523 
00537 int lod_ost_pool_add(struct ost_pool *op, __u32 idx, unsigned int min_count)
00538 {
00539         unsigned int i;
00540         int rc = 0;
00541         ENTRY;
00542 
00543         down_write(&op->op_rw_sem);
00544 
00545         rc = lod_ost_pool_extend(op, min_count);
00546         if (rc)
00547                 GOTO(out, rc);
00548 
00549         /* search ost in pool array */
00550         for (i = 0; i < op->op_count; i++) {
00551                 if (op->op_array[i] == idx)
00552                         GOTO(out, rc = -EEXIST);
00553         }
00554         /* ost not found we add it */
00555         op->op_array[op->op_count] = idx;
00556         op->op_count++;
00557         EXIT;
00558 out:
00559         up_write(&op->op_rw_sem);
00560         return rc;
00561 }
00562 
00577 int lod_ost_pool_remove(struct ost_pool *op, __u32 idx)
00578 {
00579         unsigned int i;
00580         ENTRY;
00581 
00582         down_write(&op->op_rw_sem);
00583 
00584         for (i = 0; i < op->op_count; i++) {
00585                 if (op->op_array[i] == idx) {
00586                         memmove(&op->op_array[i], &op->op_array[i + 1],
00587                                 (op->op_count - i - 1) *
00588                                 sizeof(op->op_array[0]));
00589                         op->op_count--;
00590                         up_write(&op->op_rw_sem);
00591                         EXIT;
00592                         return 0;
00593                 }
00594         }
00595 
00596         up_write(&op->op_rw_sem);
00597         RETURN(-EINVAL);
00598 }
00599 
00611 int lod_ost_pool_free(struct ost_pool *op)
00612 {
00613         ENTRY;
00614 
00615         if (op->op_size == 0)
00616                 RETURN(0);
00617 
00618         down_write(&op->op_rw_sem);
00619 
00620         OBD_FREE(op->op_array, op->op_size * sizeof(op->op_array[0]));
00621         op->op_array = NULL;
00622         op->op_count = 0;
00623         op->op_size = 0;
00624 
00625         up_write(&op->op_rw_sem);
00626         RETURN(0);
00627 }
00628 
00643 int lod_pool_new(struct obd_device *obd, char *poolname)
00644 {
00645         struct lod_device *lod = lu2lod_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
00646         struct pool_desc  *new_pool;
00647         int rc;
00648         ENTRY;
00649 
00650         if (strlen(poolname) > LOV_MAXPOOLNAME)
00651                 RETURN(-ENAMETOOLONG);
00652 
00653         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(new_pool);
00654         if (new_pool == NULL)
00655                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00656 
00657         strlcpy(new_pool->pool_name, poolname, sizeof(new_pool->pool_name));
00658         new_pool->pool_lobd = obd;
00659         atomic_set(&new_pool->pool_refcount, 1);
00660         rc = lod_ost_pool_init(&new_pool->pool_obds, 0);
00661         if (rc)
00662                 GOTO(out_err, rc);
00663 
00664         lod_qos_rr_init(&new_pool->pool_rr);
00665         rc = lod_ost_pool_init(&new_pool->pool_rr.lqr_pool, 0);
00666         if (rc)
00667                 GOTO(out_free_pool_obds, rc);
00668 
00669         INIT_HLIST_NODE(&new_pool->pool_hash);
00670 
00671 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
00672         pool_getref(new_pool);
00673         new_pool->pool_proc_entry = lprocfs_add_simple(lod->lod_pool_proc_entry,
00674                                                        poolname, new_pool,
00675                                                        &pool_proc_operations);
00676         if (IS_ERR(new_pool->pool_proc_entry)) {
00677                 CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "%s: cannot add proc entry "LOV_POOLNAMEF"\n",
00678                        obd->obd_name, poolname);
00679                 new_pool->pool_proc_entry = NULL;
00680                 lod_pool_putref(new_pool);
00681         }
00682         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "pool %p - proc %p\n", new_pool,
00683                new_pool->pool_proc_entry);
00684 #endif
00685 
00686         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00687         list_add_tail(&new_pool->pool_list, &lod->lod_pool_list);
00688         lod->lod_pool_count++;
00689         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00690 
00691         /* add to find only when it fully ready  */
00692         rc = cfs_hash_add_unique(lod->lod_pools_hash_body, poolname,
00693                                  &new_pool->pool_hash);
00694         if (rc)
00695                 GOTO(out_err, rc = -EEXIST);
00696 
00697         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, LOV_POOLNAMEF" is pool #%d\n",
00698                         poolname, lod->lod_pool_count);
00699 
00700         RETURN(0);
00701 
00702 out_err:
00703         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00704         list_del_init(&new_pool->pool_list);
00705         lod->lod_pool_count--;
00706         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00707 
00708         lprocfs_remove(&new_pool->pool_proc_entry);
00709 
00710         lod_ost_pool_free(&new_pool->pool_rr.lqr_pool);
00711 out_free_pool_obds:
00712         lod_ost_pool_free(&new_pool->pool_obds);
00713         OBD_FREE_PTR(new_pool);
00714         return rc;
00715 }
00716 
00726 int lod_pool_del(struct obd_device *obd, char *poolname)
00727 {
00728         struct lod_device *lod = lu2lod_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
00729         struct pool_desc  *pool;
00730         ENTRY;
00731 
00732         /* lookup and kill hash reference */
00733         pool = cfs_hash_del_key(lod->lod_pools_hash_body, poolname);
00734         if (pool == NULL)
00735                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00736 
00737         if (pool->pool_proc_entry != NULL) {
00738                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "proc entry %p\n", pool->pool_proc_entry);
00739                 lprocfs_remove(&pool->pool_proc_entry);
00740                 lod_pool_putref(pool);
00741         }
00742 
00743         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00744         list_del_init(&pool->pool_list);
00745         lod->lod_pool_count--;
00746         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00747 
00748         /* release last reference */
00749         lod_pool_putref(pool);
00750 
00751         RETURN(0);
00752 }
00753 
00766 int lod_pool_add(struct obd_device *obd, char *poolname, char *ostname)
00767 {
00768         struct lod_device       *lod = lu2lod_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
00769         struct obd_uuid          ost_uuid;
00770         struct pool_desc        *pool;
00771         unsigned int             idx;
00772         int                      rc = -EINVAL;
00773         ENTRY;
00774 
00775         pool = cfs_hash_lookup(lod->lod_pools_hash_body, poolname);
00776         if (pool == NULL)
00777                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00778 
00779         obd_str2uuid(&ost_uuid, ostname);
00780 
00781         /* search ost in lod array */
00782         lod_getref(&lod->lod_ost_descs);
00783         lod_foreach_ost(lod, idx) {
00784                 if (obd_uuid_equals(&ost_uuid, &OST_TGT(lod, idx)->ltd_uuid)) {
00785                         rc = 0;
00786                         break;
00787                 }
00788         }
00789 
00790         if (rc)
00791                 GOTO(out, rc);
00792 
00793         rc = lod_ost_pool_add(&pool->pool_obds, idx, lod->lod_osts_size);
00794         if (rc)
00795                 GOTO(out, rc);
00796 
00797         pool->pool_rr.lqr_dirty = 1;
00798 
00799         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "Added %s to "LOV_POOLNAMEF" as member %d\n",
00800                         ostname, poolname,  pool_tgt_count(pool));
00801 
00802         EXIT;
00803 out:
00804         lod_putref(lod, &lod->lod_ost_descs);
00805         lod_pool_putref(pool);
00806         return rc;
00807 }
00808 
00823 int lod_pool_remove(struct obd_device *obd, char *poolname, char *ostname)
00824 {
00825         struct lod_device       *lod = lu2lod_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
00826         struct obd_uuid          ost_uuid;
00827         struct pool_desc        *pool;
00828         unsigned int             idx;
00829         int                      rc = -EINVAL;
00830         ENTRY;
00831 
00832         pool = cfs_hash_lookup(lod->lod_pools_hash_body, poolname);
00833         if (pool == NULL)
00834                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00835 
00836         obd_str2uuid(&ost_uuid, ostname);
00837 
00838         lod_getref(&lod->lod_ost_descs);
00839         cfs_foreach_bit(lod->lod_ost_bitmap, idx) {
00840                 if (obd_uuid_equals(&ost_uuid, &OST_TGT(lod, idx)->ltd_uuid)) {
00841                         rc = 0;
00842                         break;
00843                 }
00844         }
00845 
00846         /* test if ost found in lod array */
00847         if (rc)
00848                 GOTO(out, rc);
00849 
00850         lod_ost_pool_remove(&pool->pool_obds, idx);
00851 
00852         pool->pool_rr.lqr_dirty = 1;
00853 
00854         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "%s removed from "LOV_POOLNAMEF"\n", ostname,
00855                poolname);
00856 
00857         EXIT;
00858 out:
00859         lod_putref(lod, &lod->lod_ost_descs);
00860         lod_pool_putref(pool);
00861         return rc;
00862 }
00863 
00876 int lod_check_index_in_pool(__u32 idx, struct pool_desc *pool)
00877 {
00878         unsigned int i;
00879         int rc;
00880         ENTRY;
00881 
00882         pool_getref(pool);
00883 
00884         down_read(&pool_tgt_rw_sem(pool));
00885 
00886         for (i = 0; i < pool_tgt_count(pool); i++) {
00887                 if (pool_tgt_array(pool)[i] == idx)
00888                         GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00889         }
00890         rc = -ENOENT;
00891         EXIT;
00892 out:
00893         up_read(&pool_tgt_rw_sem(pool));
00894 
00895         lod_pool_putref(pool);
00896         return rc;
00897 }
00898 
00909 struct pool_desc *lod_find_pool(struct lod_device *lod, char *poolname)
00910 {
00911         struct pool_desc *pool;
00912 
00913         pool = NULL;
00914         if (poolname[0] != '\0') {
00915                 pool = cfs_hash_lookup(lod->lod_pools_hash_body, poolname);
00916                 if (pool == NULL)
00917                         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "%s: request for an unknown pool ("
00918                                LOV_POOLNAMEF")\n",
00919                                lod->lod_child_exp->exp_obd->obd_name, poolname);
00920                 if (pool != NULL && pool_tgt_count(pool) == 0) {
00921                         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "%s: request for an empty pool ("
00922                                LOV_POOLNAMEF")\n",
00923                                lod->lod_child_exp->exp_obd->obd_name, poolname);
00924                         /* pool is ignored, so we remove ref on it */
00925                         lod_pool_putref(pool);
00926                         pool = NULL;
00927                 }
00928         }
00929         return pool;
00930 }
00931
